prompts.prompt: Write a short explanation (150-250 words) that you could use to teach someone who has never studied economics about supply and demand. Make sure to explain both concepts and how they differ.

criteria.excellent: Completely accurate definitions and explanations, no errors
Crystal clear, uses accessible language, well-organized
Covers demand, supply, laws of each, and key differences
criteria.good: Covers main points but may miss some details

criteria.excellent: Includes relevant, clear examples that enhance understanding
criteria.good: Includes examples but they may be generic

prompts.prompt: Analyze the following scenario: 'During the COVID-19 pandemic, the price of hand sanitizer initially spiked dramatically, then eventually fell below pre-pandemic levels.' Write a 200-300 word analysis explaining what happened to supply and demand curves throughout this period. Be specific about shifts vs. movements and the factors driving changes.

criteria.excellent: Correctly identifies demand spike (right shift) during panic buying, then demand decline (left shift) as pandemic continued. May note supply constraints initially (left shift) and increased production later (right shift)
criteria.good: Identifies major demand changes correctly, may be less precise on supply dynamics
criteria.insufficient: Confuses shifts and movements or misidentifies changes

criteria.excellent: Clearly distinguishes shifts from movements, explains factors driving shifts
criteria.developing: Some confusion between shifts and movements

criteria.excellent: Explains WHY curves shifted (panic buying, health concerns, production ramping up, behavior changes)

mastery_criteria.note: Written assessments take longer, so fewer required than dialogue
